text: "X" is one of the most impressive games from E3 for me, especially considering it looks completely out of place on the WiiU.

text: I never played this game before but holy shit that's a beautiful music. *repeating tons of times*
author: Manolo Vasquez

text: FFXV looks amazing! I'm looking forward to it. The gameplay looks very design. I hated 12's story but the battle mechanics was what future FF games need. I'm not a fan of the "random encounters" but to be able to see the enemies and pass them...this makes progression much more enjoyable
author: The Destati

text: what do you think about KH3?
author: phantomgamers1

text: I was thinking about getting this game while it was on sale due to hearing about comparisons with Super Metroid (which I'm currently replaying).  In the end I didn't.  I wonder if I should have.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: Do you feel it could be a new golden age like with the ps1/n64, but now for ps4/wii-u? Square seems to be back. Nintendo seems to be somewhat back. Bigger, better games from everyone
author: Everlasting

text: Two games oozing charm that I'm cautiously optimistic about. I feel like they're also two games that could completely fail financially if the quality isn't high enough to support them. Insomniac learned that recently with Fuse, so we'll see what happens with their Sunset Overdrive (keeping that colorful presentation will be key).
author: SupraDarky

text: How do you feel about Sunset Overdrive and Yaiba?
author: The Pits

text: So the E3 conferences are over. My thoughts? Microsoft completely dropped the ball, Sony did everything they had to do and Nintendo played it safe when they shouldn't have. I wish the new Mario was Land 2 for the 3DS and that we had a bigger, 64/Galaxy-like game for the Wii U. Retro is making a sequel to one of my favorite platformers ever, yet I wish it was a new IP or Metroid Prime. FF15 looks great and The Division is my surprise of the show so far, if it really plays the way it should.
author: SupraDarky

text: I watched a friend play this game, he was completely stumped at a puzzle and then I quickly decided to stop watching and buy the game for myself, which I will. It's looking like an awesomely atmospheric puzzle metroidvania.
author: SupraDarky
